How do I run JavaScript when the DOM is ready - without jQuery?

Feb 27, 2019

I often rely on jQuery purely for the $("document").ready function - which feels wrong.

In some cases, I really just want to run some small code when the page is ready. Iâ€™d like to do it in vanilla javascript, because these use cases are particularly well suited for vanilla.

Replace the document ready from jQuery with:

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
    // Your code to be executed here
});
